newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish bond prices unmoved by cabinet shuffle.
newsitem.headline: Danish bond prices unmoved by cabinet shuffle.

text.p: Danish bond prices ended the last trading day of 1996 unmoved, despite a cabinet shuffle, but traders had high hopes for the New Year.

"There is some liquidity waiting to be placed and so we expect to see the yield gap to Germany narrow in the near term," a dealer said. The cabinet shakeup after the resignation of two Centre Democrat ministers was of no consequence," he added.
"The government is not going to the polls for the time being so it is unimportant to the markets who is minister of culture."
The benchmark eight percent state bond due 2006 closed at 109.82, unchanged from Friday's close and Monday's opening.
Benchmark turnover was 1.6 billion crowns. Its March future rose 0.11 point to 109.06 with 352 contracts traded.
The six percent mortgage bond due 2026 gained 0.45 point to 87.05.
The crown ended the day at 3.8250 per mark, unchanged from Friday, after earlier firming slightly to 3.8248.
The 10-year yield gap with Germany widened to 76 basis points from 75 bp. --Steve Weizman, Copenhagen newsroom, 45-33-969650
